Function Documentation

int cvmx_lan_bypass_force ( int  force_bypass  ) 

Control LAN bypass via software.

Parameters:
force_bypass Force LAN bypass to active (1) or inactive (0)
Returns:
Error code, or 0 in case of success
static int cvmx_lan_bypass_init ( void   )  [static]
int cvmx_lan_bypass_is_active ( void   ) 

Return status of LAN bypass circuit.

Returns:
1 if ports are in LAN bypass, or 0 if normally connected
void cvmx_lan_bypass_keep_alive ( void   ) 

Refresh watchdog timer.

Call periodically (less than 1 second) to prevent triggering LAN bypass. The alternative cvmx_lan_bypass_keep_alive_ms() is provided for cases where a variable interval is required.

void cvmx_lan_bypass_keep_alive_ms ( uint32_t  interval_ms  ) 

Refresh watchdog timer, setting a specific expiration interval.

Parameters:
interval_ms Interval, in milliseconds, to next watchdog expiration.
int cvmx_lan_bypass_mode_set ( cvmx_lan_bypass_mode_t  mode  ) 

Set LAN bypass mode.

Supported modes are:

  • CVMX_LAN_BYPASS_OFF
    LAN ports are connected ( port 0 <--> Octeon <--> port 1 )
  • CVMX_LAN_BYPASS_GPIO
    LAN bypass is controlled by software using cvmx_lan_bypass_force() function. When transitioning to this mode, default is LAN bypass enabled ( port 0 <--> port 1, -- Octeon ).
  • CVMX_LAN_BYPASS_WATCHDOG
    LAN bypass is inactive as long as a watchdog is kept alive. The default expiration time is 1 second and the function to call periodically to prevent watchdog expiration is cvmx_lan_bypass_keep_alive().
Parameters:
mode LAN bypass mode
Returns:
Error code, or 0 in case of success
